TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_B_23
TestCase.Purpose: This test checks the behavior of the eID-Client in case the message "StartPAOSResponse" contains an erroneous result.
TestCase.Precondition: A single card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.
The eID-Card has the following trust point(s): [CERT_CV_CVCA_1] from [CERT_SET_1].
If applicable, the eID-Client has the following trust point(s): [CERT_CV_CVCA_1] from [CERT_SET_1].
The eID-Client has been activated and the communication channels TLS-1, TLS-1-2 and TLS-2 have been established.
The eService uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_1] from [CERT_SET_1].
The eID-Server uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_EIDSERVER_1] from [CERT_SET_1].
The eService has sent a default TC Token to the eID-Client.
The eID-Client and the eID-Server have established PAOS communication.

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC1InputType" contains the parameters "Certificate" and "CertificateDescription".
The certificate chain from [CERT_SET_1] is sent in given order: [CERT_CV_TERM_1_A], [CERT_CV_DV_1_A].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client displays EAC data received from the eID-Server before the user enters his PIN.
The eID-Client requests the PIN.

Command.Text: Do not change CertificateHolderAuthorizationTemplate and enter the correct PIN of the eID-Card.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client responds with the message "DIDAuthenticateResponse_EAC1OutputType".
The message contains at least the following elements: "Result", "EFCardAccess", "IDPICC" and "Challenge".
The element "Result" contains exactly one element "ResultMajor" which equals /resultmajor#ok.
The element "EFCardAccess" matches the card file EF.CardAccess.

Command.Text: The eID-Server generates a fresh key pair for Chip Authentication using valid domain parameters, creates a valid signature of the received challenge using [CERT_CV_TERM_1_A] and invokes "DIDAuthenticate_EAC2InputType".

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC2InputType" contains the parameters "EphemeralPublicKey" and "Signature".
The element "EphemeralPublicKey" contains the generated public key for Chip Authentication.
The element "Signature" contains the calculated signature for Terminal Authentication.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client responds with the message "DIDAuthenticateResponse_EAC2OutputType_A".
The message contains at least the following elements: "Result", "EFCardSecurity", "AuthenticationToken" and "Nonce".
The element "Result" contains exactly one element "ResultMajor" which equals /resultmajor#ok.
The element "EFCardSecurity" matches the card file EF.CardSecurity.
The element "AuthenticationToken" can be verified.
The element "Nonce" is used to calculate session keys for secure messaging.

Command.Text: The eID-Server generates a secure messaging command APDU to verify that the session keys are valid and invokes "Transmit".

TestStep.Description: The message "Transmit" contains the default parameters.
The element "InputAPDUInfo" contains exactly one element "InputAPDU".

The element "InputAPDU" contains the secure messaging command APDU '0C B0 9C 00 0D 97 01 01 8E 08 [checksum] 00', where [checksum] is a valid secure messaging checksum calculated by using the session keys.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client responds with the message "TransmitResponse".
The element "Result" contains exactly one element "ResultMajor" which equals /resultmajor#ok.
There is exactly one element "OutputAPDU". It is a valid secure messaging response APDU and contains the first byte of EF.CardAccess and the status word '90 00'.

TestStep.Description: The result codes returned in "StartPAOSResponse" are "/resultmajor#error" and "/resultminor/al/common#internalError".

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client aborts the Online-Authentication and indicates an error.
The eID-Client starts establishment of a TLS session (i. e. performs a TLS handshake without HTTP interaction) to the server of the refresh URL to retrieve the server certificate of this server.
The URL used by the eID-Client matches the "RefreshAddress" element from the TC Token.

Command.Text: The eService accepts the connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The eService uses the same TLS server certificate as used for the initial TLS-1-2 connection.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client directs the browser to the "RefreshAddress".
In case of a web server based Client-Interface, the eID-Client uses "303 See Other" for the redirection.
The direction includes an additional URL-Parameter "ResultMajor=error&ResultMinor=res_min", where res_min is "serverError" or another suitable error description.
